member.name: T:NWebsec.Csp.CspViolationReport
member.summary: Represents a Content Security Policy violation report.

member.name: P:NWebsec.Csp.CspViolationReport.Details
member.summary: Gets the detailed Content Security Policy violation report. The default is the empty string.

member.name: P:NWebsec.Csp.CspViolationReport.UserAgent
member.summary: Gets the User Agent that reported the Content Security Policy violation. The default is the empty string.

member.name: T:NWebsec.Csp.CspReportDetails
member.summary: Represents the detailed Content Security Policy violation report. The default is the empty string.
member.remarks: Browser implementations differ, it might vary which fields are set in the violation report.

member.name: P:NWebsec.Csp.CspReportDetails.DocumentUri
member.summary: Gets the address of the protected resource where the policy was violated. The default is the empty string.

member.name: P:NWebsec.Csp.CspReportDetails.Referrer
member.summary: Gets the referrer attribute of the protected resource. The default is the empty string.

member.name: P:NWebsec.Csp.CspReportDetails.BlockedUri
member.summary: Gets the URI of the resource that was prevented from loading due to the policy violation. The default is the empty string.

member.name: P:NWebsec.Csp.CspReportDetails.ViolatedDirective
member.summary: Gets the policy directive that was violated. The default is the empty string.

member.name: P:NWebsec.Csp.CspReportDetails.OriginalPolicy
member.summary: Gets the original policy as received by the user-agent. The default is the empty string.

member.name: T:NWebsec.Csp.CspViolationReportEventArgs
member.summary: Represents the event data for a Content Security Policy violation.

member.name: P:NWebsec.Csp.CspViolationReportEventArgs.ViolationReport
member.summary: Gets the Content Security Policy violation report. Treat the data as unvalidated input.

member.name: F:NWebsec.Csp.Source.Inherit
member.summary: The source should inherit previous settings.

member.name: F:NWebsec.Csp.Source.Enable
member.summary: The source should be enabled, overriding previous settings.

member.name: F:NWebsec.Csp.Source.Disable
member.summary: The source should be disabled, clearing previous settings.

member.name: F:NWebsec.HttpHeaders.XFrameOptionsPolicy.Disabled
member.summary: Specifies that the X-Frame-Options header should not be set in the HTTP response.

member.name: F:NWebsec.HttpHeaders.XFrameOptionsPolicy.Deny
member.summary: Specifies that the X-Frame-Options header should be set in the HTTP response, instructing the browser to not display the page when it is loaded in an iframe.

member.name: F:NWebsec.HttpHeaders.XFrameOptionsPolicy.SameOrigin
member.summary: Specifies that the X-Frame-Options header should be set in the HTTP response, instructing the browser to display the page when it is loaded in an iframe - but only if the iframe is from the same origin as the page.

member.name: F:NWebsec.HttpHeaders.XXssProtectionPolicy.Disabled
member.summary: Specifies that the X-Xss-Protection header should not be set in the HTTP response.

member.name: F:NWebsec.HttpHeaders.XXssProtectionPolicy.FilterDisabled
member.summary: Specifies that the X-Xss-Protection header should be set in the HTTP response, explicitly disabling the IE XSS filter.

member.name: F:NWebsec.HttpHeaders.XXssProtectionPolicy.FilterEnabled
member.summary: Specifies that the X-Xss-Protection header should be set in the HTTP response, explicitly enabling the IE XSS filter.
